support_summary: TCP1 (subunit of TRiC/CCT) physically binds ATXN3, particularly the mutant form (MS and Co-IP evidence)

functions.cellular_process: Mutant ATXN3 binds to the TCP1 subunit of the TRiC/CCT complex, leading to the sequestration of the chaperonin and preventing it from folding essential substrates like actin and tubulin.
functions.effect_description: Mutant ATXN3 impairs the chaperonin activity of the TRiC complex by sequestering its core subunits.
biological_consequence: Mutant ATXN3/TCP1 interaction → TRiC sequestration → impaired protein folding → cytoskeletal defects and aggregation
Loss of TRiC function → accumulation of misfolded actin and tubulin → axonal transport deficits
specific_effects: Reduced levels of soluble actin and tubulin in SCA3 models
Increased formation of mutant ATXN3 inclusions due to loss of chaperone capacity

evidence.paper_title: Impaired interactions of ataxin-3 with protein complexes reveals their specific structure and functions in SCA3 Ki150 model

mechanism: Mutant ATXN3 binds to the TCP1 subunit of the TRiC/CCT complex, leading to the sequestration of the chaperonin and preventing it from folding essential substrates like actin and tubulin.
effect: Mutant ATXN3 impairs the chaperonin activity of the TRiC complex by sequestering its core subunits.
summary: ATXN3 inhibits TCP1 to modulate tric-mediated protein folding, ultimately affecting cytoskeletal defects and aggregation.

evidence.paper_title: Impaired interactions of ataxin-3 with protein complexes reveals their specific structure and functions in SCA3 Ki150 model

initial_pathway.reasoning: TCP1 is a subunit of the TRiC/CCT chaperonin complex. Ataxin-3 interacts with this complex to modulate the folding and aggregation of polyglutamine proteins, falling under the root of Protein Quality Control.
